thread.title: GH Recap: Ava's surprised by Sonny after he hears something disturbing
thread.title_full: GH Recap: Ava's surprised by Sonny after he hears something disturbing

title: GH Recap: Ava's surprised by Sonny after he hears something disturbing
text:
GH Recap: Ava's surprised by Sonny after he hears something disturbing 
Violette DeSantis Wednesday, February 8th, 2017 
Wednesday February 8, 2017: Lulu makes Charlotte uncomfortable again, Anna struggles with her unsettling memories, and Sonny breaks the law. Pin 
At Crimson, Maxie pushes Lulu into the room where Charlotte’s coloring and encourages her to be motherly and bond before leaving them alone. Alone, Charlotte becomes upset, screaming, “I want my mommy!” Nina arrives and rushes in with Maxie. Lulu leaves agreeably at Nina’s request after Charlotte demands she go. Alone, Nina comforts Charlotte who wants to be just like Nina someday. Nina replies, “You’re going to be so much better than me.” Maxie rushes with Lulu to the elevator, apologizing but Lulu doesn’t blame her. After, Nina confronts Maxie, upset about her going behind her back. Maxie’s sorry and doesn’t want Nina to tell Valentin. She tries to get back to work but Nina fires her. 
Kevin awakes Laura, at his place, during her nightmare. She dreams of being at Cassadine Island and shooting Valentin before he can kill Nikolas. Kevin's not creeped out but asks her to explain more. Laura remembers telling Anna she’d do anything to protect Lulu from Valentin. 
In the Metro Court restaurant, Anna explains to Robert over the phone that she doesn’t appreciate her access being restricted at the WSB after Valentin’s dossier disappeared when her computer was hacked. She disconnects reminding him she doesn’t have to be nice to an ex-husband but promises to thank him if he can help. Griffin joins her and listens to her concerns, she wonders if she led Valentin on. Griffin has to go but leaves her with a story about a classmate of his. Alone, she calls Robert about Valentin’s classmate, Carl Browning. Nearby, Laura meets Lulu who admits she upset Charlotte again. She worries that Nina will tell Valentin and she’ll lose Charlotte. Laura asks Lulu to leave it to her. 
At the PCPD, Jordan meets with Dante to confirm there is nothing tying Sonny to the car bombing. She explains they found the person who planted the bomb but he’s vanished. Jordan can’t convince the D.A. to drop her case against Sonny. She remembers kissing Curtis when Dante asks what else happened in Baltimore. She tells him nothing but she thinks he should go there. Suddenly, Buzz interrupts and Jordan introduces him as the person who could save Sonny. Buzz apologizes to Dante, sorry for Morgan’s death. He gives Jordan a note before Dante takes him to process for protective custody. Alone she reads it, someone believes Jordan will protect him. She smiles and picks up her phone. 
Spotlight on… General Hospital Spoiler Video: Don’t make an enemy of Sonny 
At the gallery, Curtis introduces himself to Ava who recognizes him from somewhere. She’s the exact person Curtis wants to see. She sees right through Curtis’ fake interest in art when he admits doing business with Julian. He lies about coming into an inheritance that allows him to indulge his passion. She regrets her accusatory tone when he impresses her with his knowledge of a collage artist. She appreciates the break after working all day with her assistant. Curtis wants to leave upon learning she’s been in the gallery all day but she’s sure she has something for him. Ava returns with a $22,000 painting and offers to charge his card. Curtis swallows nervously, handing it to her. Alone, he thinks nothing is adding up and texts Jason. Ava returns, his transaction was rejected. His phone beeps. He has to go and promises to sort it out with his bank. Alone, Ava wonders what Curtis is up to. 
Jason meets Sam at GH before their appointment with Dr. Lee. He starts to explain what he and Curtis learned when Dr. Lee comes in. She shares concern over irregular test results on the baby’s heartbeat. They’ll take precautions and test further if necessary. They leave with Jason wondering if Sam is worried. She’s more interested in who’s responsible for Morgan’s death. Jason receives an all-caps text from Curtis about Ava not being the boss. Sam’s glad Jason didn’t tell Sonny. Since things don’t make sense, Jason's not ready to tell Sonny anything. 
More: Kelly McGillis in An Uncommon Grace on Hallmark 
Curtis joins Jordan in her office. She thanks him for his help, letting him know Buzz came back. 
Brick arrives at Sonny’s with the audio feed and surveillance video that Curtis and Jason obtained. He doesn’t mean to criticize but worries about Sonny second-guessing Jason. Sonny’s interested in what Jason may be protecting him from. They view the images together. Sonny makes him back up a few images and Brick asks if he recognizes the blond-haired woman. He doesn’t but is sure whatever Jason is hiding is on the recording. Brick gives Sonny headphones. Sonny stops when he hears Julian express he’s tired of living in fear of his sister. Sonny’s sure it’s Ava and asks Brick for a favor. Later, Dante arrives with good news but Sonny’s not home. Dante finds Sonny’s ankle monitor on the bar. 
Ava’s alone in the gallery when Sonny arrives. 
Curtis tells Jordan they're done. 
Kristina and Molly are ready to toast Alexis' return to law. 
Andre questions Hayden about GH layoffs. 
Olivia doesn't trust her little brother, Julian. 
Carly tells Jason that Sonny broke house arrest. 
Sonny confronts Ava about her part in Morgan's death.
